headline: Microsoft earnings, Fed decision, Trump-Xi meeting: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Wednesday, October 29, including the Federal Reserve's latest decision around interest rates; earnings from Magnificent Seven tech companies Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), Meta Platforms (META), and Microsoft (MSFT); and President Trump's meeting with his Chinese counterpart, President Xi Jinping, in South Korea. headline: Microsoft holds 27% of OpenAI in revamped partnership
summary:
Microsoft and OpenAI announced Tuesday a sweeping overhaul of their landmark artificial intelligence (AI) partnership, giving both companies greater independence while maintaining their close collaboration.This refers to the pursuit of artificial general intelligence, a level of AI development that matches or exceeds human capability and was a crucial aspect in the company's previous agreements.
arp-gc/jgc

headline: Wall Street reacts to Microsoft and OpenAI's new deal
summary: The Windows maker would hold a stake of about $135 billion - or 27% - in OpenAI Group PBC, which will be controlled by the OpenAI Foundation, a nonprofit.  It resolves the longstanding issue of OpenAI being organized as a not-for-profit (organization) and settles the ownership rights of the technology vis-a-vis Microsoft.

Caroline Hyde reports on Bloomberg Television.

headline: Apple races past $4 trillion market value as latest models revitalize iPhone sales
summary: Apple's shares have gained about 13% since the new launches on September 9, in a remarkable turnaround that pushed the stock into positive territory for the first time this year.  "The iPhone accounts for over half of Apple's profit and revenue and the more phones they can get into the hands of people, the more they can drive people into their ecosystem," said Chris Zaccarelli, chief investment officer for Northlight Asset Management, ahead of the milestone.  Apple shares had struggled earlier this year on concerns over tough competition in China and uncertainties around how the company would navigate high U.S. tariffs on Asian economies such as China and India, its major manufacturing hubs.

raw.headline: Apple races past $4 trillion market value as latest models revitalize iPhone sales

"The iPhone accounts for over half of Apple's profit and revenue and the more phones they can get into the hands of people, the more they can drive people into their ecosystem," said Chris Zaccarelli, chief investment officer for Northlight Asset Management, ahead of the milestone.  Apple shares had struggled earlier this year on concerns over tough competition in China and uncertainties around how the company would navigate high U.S. tariffs on Asian economies such as China and India, its major manufacturing hubs.

headline: Microsoft stake in OpenAI valued at $135B after reaching new deal
summary: Microsoft's (MSFT) stake in OpenAI's non-profit entity (OPAI.PVT) is now valued at $135 billion following the latter's recapitalization. This new agreement also has OpenAI paying for $250 billion in Microsoft Azure services. Morning Brief host Julie Hyman reports more on this breaking news. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Microsoft, OpenAI reach new deal valuing OpenAI at $500 billion
summary: (Reuters) -Microsoft and OpenAI on Tuesday said they had reached a deal to allow the ChatGPT maker to restructure itself into a public benefit corporation, valuing OpenAI at $500 billion and clearing the way for it to become a publicly traded company.  Microsoft would hold a stake of about $135 billion - or 27% - in OpenAI Group PBC, which will be controlled by the OpenAI Foundation, a nonprofit.  The deal removes a major constraint on raising capital for OpenAI, which was founded as a nonprofit AI safety group and which signed a deal in 2019 with Microsoft that gave the Redmond, Washington-based firm rights over much of OpenAI's work in exchange for providing the costly cloud computing services neede2d to carry it out.

raw.headline: Microsoft, OpenAI reach new deal valuing OpenAI at $500 billion
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Microsoft and OpenAI on Tuesday said they had reached a deal to allow the ChatGPT maker to restructure itself into a public benefit corporation, valuing OpenAI at $500 billion and clearing the way for it to become a publicly traded company.  Microsoft would hold a stake of about $135 billion - or 27% - in OpenAI Group PBC, which will be controlled by the OpenAI Foundation, a nonprofit.  The deal removes a major constraint on raising capital for OpenAI, which was founded as a nonprofit AI safety group and which signed a deal in 2019 with Microsoft that gave the Redmond, Washington-based firm rights over much of OpenAI's work in exchange for providing the costly cloud computing services neede2d to carry it out.

headline: Fed lookahead, Amazon layoffs, earnings latest: 3 Things
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are moving in positive territory on Tuesday morning as Wall Street looks ahead to the Federal Reserve's interest rate decision and the first round of Big Tech earnings results tomorrow. Magnificent Seven companies Meta Platforms (META), Microsoft (MSFT), and Alphabet (GOOGL, GOOG) will be reporting quarterly results on Wednesday, and Amazon (AMZN) and Apple (AAPL) will publish their releases on Thursday. Amazon laid off 14,000 corporate workers on Tuesday after Reuters originally reported on Monday that firings could reach up to 30,000 roles. UnitedHealth Group (UNH), United Parcel Service (UPS), and PayPal (PYPL) all reported third quarter earnings results and their shares are all seeing a boost in pre-market trading. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Keepit Platform Recognized for Data Protection and Cyber Resilience at 2025 Top InfoSec Innovator Awards
summary: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, October 28, 2025--Keepit, a global provider of a comprehensive cloud backup and recovery platform, today announced it has won in four categories at the Top Infosec Innovator 2025 awards. Keepit was named the winner in the following categories: "Hot Company Data Protection", "Hot Company Data Security", "Hot Company Cyber Resilience" and "Hot Company Data Recovery".
